Class Shipment

java.lang.Object
  Shipment

public class Shipment
extends java.lang.Object

The Shipment class is used to keep a list of the products to be shipped to a customer. A shipment contains customer information and a set of line items that indicates what products are to be shipped to the customer. Each line item contains a product id and a quantity. A maximum of 20 line items can be added to a shipment.

Version:
2007-09
Author:
J. Bigus

Method Detail

addLineItem

public boolean addLineItem(LineItem lineItem)
Adds a line item to the shipment.

Parameters:
lineItem - the line item to be added to inventory.
Returns:
true if the line item was added successfully, and false if the line item was not added.

getCustomerId

public java.lang.String getCustomerId()
Gets the customer id.

Returns:
the customer id to whom the products will be shipped.

getLineItems

public LineItem[] getLineItems()
Returns an array of LineItems.

Returns:
the array of line items in the shipment. The array is only as big as it needs to be with no empty elements in the array.

setCustomerId

public void setCustomerId(java.lang.String id)
Sets the id of the customer to whom the products are being shipped.

Parameters:
id - the customer id.
